1.text: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

2.text: Me hath he led, and brought into darkness, and not into light.

3.text: Surely against me hath he turned again and again his hand all the day.

4.text: My flesh and my skin hath he wasted away, he hath broken my bones.

5.text: He hath built against me, and encompassed [me] with gall and toil.

6.text: He hath made me to dwell in dark places as those that have been long dead.

7.text: He hath hedged me about that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.

8.text: Even when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.

9.text: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.

10.text: He is unto me [as] a bear lying in wait, a lion in secret places.

11.text: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces; he hath made me desolate.

12.text: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

13.text: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.

14.text: I am become a derision to all my people; their song all the day.

15.text: He hath sated me with bitterness, he hath made me drunk with wormwood.

16.text: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.

17.text: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I have forgotten prosperity.

18.text: And I said, My strength is perished, and my hope in Jehovah.

19.text: Remember thou mine affliction and my wandering, the wormwood and the gall.

20.text: My soul hath [them] constantly in remembrance, and is humbled in me.

21.text: This I recall to heart, therefore have I hope.

22.text: It is of Jehovah’s loving-kindness we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not;

23.text: they are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.

24.text: Jehovah is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

25.text: Jehovah is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul [that] seeketh him.

26.text: It is good that one should both wait, and that in silence, for the salvation of Jehovah.

27.text: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth:

28.text: He sitteth solitary and keepeth silence, because he hath laid it upon him;

29.text: he putteth his mouth in the dust, if so be there may be hope;

30.text: he giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him; he is filled full with reproach.

31.text: For the Lord will not cast off for ever;

32.text: but if he have caused grief, he will have compassion according to the multitude of his loving-kindnesses:

33.text: for he doth not willingly afflict or grieve the children of men.

34.text: To crush under foot all the prisoners of the earth,

35.text: to turn aside the right of a man before the face of the Most High,

36.text: to wrong a man in his cause,—will not the Lord see it?

37.text: Who is he that saith, and there cometh to pass, what the Lord hath not commanded?

38.text: Out of the mouth of the Most High doth not there proceed evil and good?

39.text: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?

40.text: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to Jehovah.

41.text: Let us lift up our heart with [our] hands unto God in the heavens.

42.text: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.

43.text: Thou hast covered thyself with anger, and pursued us; thou hast slain, thou hast not spared.

44.text: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that prayer should not pass through.

45.text: Thou hast made us the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the peoples.

46.text: All our enemies have opened their mouth against us.

47.text: Fear and the pit are come upon us, devastation and ruin.

48.text: Mine eye runneth down with streams of water for the ruin of the daughter of my people.

49.text: Mine eye poureth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

50.text: till Jehovah look down and behold from the heavens.

51.text: Mine eye affecteth my soul, because of all the daughters of my city.

52.text: They that are mine enemies without cause have chased me sore like a bird.

53.text: They have cut off my life in a pit, and cast a stone upon me.

54.text: Waters streamed over my head; I said, I am cut off.

55.text: I called upon thy name, Jehovah, out of the lowest pit.

56.text: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my sighing, at my cry.

57.text: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee; thou saidst, Fear not.

58.text: Lord, thou hast pleaded the cause of my soul, thou hast redeemed my life.

59.text: Jehovah, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.

60.text: Thou hast seen all their vengeance, all their imaginations against me.

61.text: Thou hast heard their reproach, O Jehovah, all their imaginations against me;

62.text: the lips of those that rise up against me and their meditation against me all the day.

63.text: Behold thou their sitting down and their rising up: I am their song.

64.text: Render unto them a recompence, O Jehovah, according to the work of their hands;

65.text: give them obduracy of heart, thy curse unto them;

66.text: pursue them in anger, and destroy them from under the heavens of Jehovah.
